title: useState Hook
description: useState is the most fundamental React hook that allows you to add state to functional components. It returns an array with the current state value and a function to update it.
explanation:
The useState hook is React's primary way to manage component state in functional components. Before hooks (introduced in React 16.8), you needed class components to have state.

Key concepts:
- Returns array: [currentState, setStateFunction]
- State updates trigger re-renders
- Can store any type of value (string, number, object, array)
- Each useState call is independent
- State updates are batched for performance

Best practices:
- Use multiple useState calls for unrelated state
- Don't mutate state directly, always use setState
- Use functional updates when new state depends on old state
- Keep state minimal and derived data in variables
useCase: Form inputs, counters, toggles, managing component-level data, UI state like modals/dropdowns
